overview:
Dan joined River Cities in 2001. He began his private equity career with Cincinnati-based Walnut Investments in 1997. Dan has been involved in a diverse set of investments including business and marketing services, software applications, and consumer oriented products and services. Over the past few years, he has assumed various administrative responsibilities within the Firm.

Dan graduated from The Ohio State University with a B.S., cum laude, in Engineering in 1986, and obtained an MBA from the Harvard Business School in 1991 with an emphasis in Finance and Business Strategy. From 1984 to 1989, he held various technically oriented positions including design engineering at Kodak and operations management with Owens-Illinois and Procter & Gamble. He also worked in strategic consulting with Towers Perrin. Upon returning to Cincinnati after business school, he rejoined P&G where he held several positions in financial analysis and strategic planning for the company.

He has served as a member of the Board of Govenors of the National Association of Small Business Investment Companies and is a past President of the Midwest Regional Association of Small Business Investment Companies. He also participates in various non-profit community activities.

Dan currently sits on the boards of NineSigma, Construction Software Technologies, HealthPro Brands, ISD and SmartSignal.
